intro: Ardisia monteverdeana, commonly known as the Monteverde ardisia, is a species of flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Ardisia monteverdeana is also valued for its role in maintaining the ecological balance of its native habitat.
